Package de.oth.blocklib.world.chunks.blockData

Class OctreeNode

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.world.chunks.blockData.OctreeNode
Direct Known Subclasses:
RootNode
public class OctreeNode
extends java.lang.Object
Author:
Stefan Hofweber (WiSe 2018/19) OctreeNodes are an alternative data structure for blocks in the chunk to multi-dimensional arrays An OctreeNode can be divided by half in every of the three axis, resulting in 8 child nodes

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int CHILDCOUNT  
    private static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f[] childMap
    Defines the internal order of the child nodes of any octree node It is basically the same array as "corners" in the class DCLUT but in a different order the differing orders have a convenience purpose for different calculations

    protected float halfEdgeLength  
    static int MIN_EDGE_LENGTH

    If all child nodes have the same material and - which is implied if they have a material - are leaves, they will get deleted and the parent node will become the leaf with this material

    • childMap

      private static final org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f[] childMap
      Defines the internal order of the child nodes of any octree node It is basically the same array as "corners" in the class DCLUT but in a different order the differing orders have a convenience purpose for different calculations
